Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Description: Small cup typical of Classic Kerma ware because of its shape and the technique used to produce it. The base is hemispherical, the mouth unrestricted and the lip thick. The clay is fine and black. The exterior surface is red with a black rim and an intermediary greyish band. The entire surface is shiny.
